alert.note: Alert for Central Mountains of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued July 07 at 6:57PM PDT until July 08 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS SATURDAY COULD LEAD TO NEW FIRE STARTS... .A surge of Pacific moisture across the mountains of eastern Oregon will trigger isolated to scattered thunderstorms Saturday afternoon and evening. While some rain will accompany the storms, dry fuels and lightning strikes outside the rain cores will favor new fire starts. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE OR640... The National Weather Service in Pendleton has issued a Fire Weather Watch for abundant lightning, which is in effect from Saturday morning through Saturday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 640 Central Mountains of Oregon. * IMPACTS...Lightning strikes may cause new fire starts. * THUNDERSTORMS...Scattered thunderstorms will form by mid afternoon and continue through the mid to late evening on Saturday. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusty and erratic winds up to 40 mph will be possible near and within storms.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
